alert.note: Alert for Okanogan; Stevens (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 04 at 2:36PM PDT until July 04 at 8:30PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Central and Northeast Washington, including the following counties, in North Central Washington, Chelan and Okanogan. In Northeast Washington, Ferry and Stevens. * WHEN...Until 11 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Late afternoon and evening thunderstorms will produce locally heavy rainfall over the north Cascades, the Okanogan Valley, Okanogan Highlands and Steven County in north central and northeast Washington. Localized rain amounts up to a half inch per hour will be possible leading to the threat of flash flooding in steep terrain and burn scar areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
